___query.description: An array of QueryParams, which is basically the query string part of the URL, parsed into separate variables

___variable.description: Postman supports path variables with the syntax `/path/:variableName/to/somewhere`. These variables are stored in this field.

___protocol.description: The protocol associated with the request, E.g: 'http'

___hash.description: Contains the URL fragment (if any). Usually this is not transmitted over the network, but it could be useful to store this in some cases.

oneOf.description: The domain, split into subdomain strings.

___domain.description: The domain for the URL, E.g: api.yourdomain.com. Can be stored as a string or as an array of strings.
___domain.title: Domain

___port.description: The port number present in this URL. An empty value implies 80/443 depending on whether the protocol field contains http/https.

oneOf.description: The complete path of the current url, broken down into segments. A segment could be a string, or a path variable.

description: If object, contains the complete broken-down URL for this request. If string, contains the literal request URL.
title: Url
